The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#14565](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/14565.html) (Overhaul importmulti logic by sipa)

If y
I've tidied up the intermediate commits and force-pushed. Should be ready for review.
Concept ACK, will review very soon
Added a new commit updating the docstring.
@practicalswift nits fixed and redundant code removed: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/compare/6c76af02e8188d0dc66c315e4ecd80308e2fa0a1..12e59a60019732fa228872848121cca4431e7513

Thanks @MeshCollider . I've addressed your review comments and pushed: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/compare/12e59a60019732fa228872848121cca4431e7513..ee3b21dccbeb0f9d4e99de869dbfaf625c159c7f

> I've left a couple of minor comments inline but I assume you might want to keep this as a refactor rather than adding any extra testing here, so feel free to ignore the last few comments.

Yes
re-utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14886/commits/ee3b21dccbeb0f9d4e99de869dbfaf625c159c7f\n\nOnly change since my last review was addressing my comments above
Post merge ACK
Thanks all for the review.\n\n@ryanofsky - your review comments are fixed here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14952
Nit: `raise AssertionError(â€¦)` is more idiomatic and consistent with the rest of the code base. Drop the unnecessary parens :-)
Nit: Use `_` instead of `i` to show that the variable is intentionally unused.
fixed. Thanks!
fixed
Why do you call this twice? EDIT: don't worry, I see the second one is removed in a later commit.
Unused?
missing `
This should also test for solvability
This should test watchonly=True
n.b. we've lost this test now, but that seems fine
IMO it wouldn't hurt to test for solvability here too to ensure the same output as listunspent below
Same here
test !ismine here?
oops. Fixed intermediate commit.
fixed
yes, removed
I didn't think this test was important, so I removed it, but I've now readded it.

In commit "[tests] add get_key function to wallet_importmulti.py" (7c99614b40301daba5e526c6e3ab281965e869c6)\n\nYou seem to be dropping the `address =` assignment in this case, while keeping it the other cases. Would be good to fix the inconsistency, I think ideally by dropping the `address` variable everywhere and replacing it with `key.p2pkh_addr`.

In commit "[tests] add get_key function to wallet_importmulti.py" (7c99614b40301daba5e526c6e3ab281965e869c6)

Would probably be better to use named arguments instead of having these little
`# p2pkh` per argument comments.

In commit "[tests] add get_multisig function to wallet_importmulti.py" (08a4a0f70f545e114bc35dc76056282cb04bf013)\n\nNote: We lose a bit of test coverage here for createmultisig method here, but this should be ok given the dedicated rpc_createmultisig.py test.

In commit "[tests] add get_multisig function to wallet_importmulti.py" (08a4a0f70f545e114bc35dc76056282cb04bf013)\n\nMight be good to say this is a 2 of 3 multisig (or even add num_required/num_keys arguments).

In commit "[tests] add test_importmulti method to wallet_import.py" (fd3a02c381ee136e54579b5a2e3466c016101515)\n\nShould consider dropping the `success` argument because it can be implied from the error arguments, and makes test_importmulti calls awkward to write & read with unnamed False/True arguments.

In commit "[tests] add test_address method to wallet_import.py" (fbdba40594d549c76aaf15401fe994ac5cfc4f73)\n\nSeems like this same function would also be useful for wallet_import_with_label.py. Maybe move it to a common place.
Agree, that at a minimum named arguments should be used at the caller.
